STA110.name: Drawing I
STA110.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA110.description: Fundamental concepts of drawing. Emphasis on observational, descriptive and analytical drawing. Practice of drawing skills using common drawing media.

STA112.name: Art and Design: Concepts and Practices
STA112.description: Theme-based study of aesthetic and conceptual issues surrounding contemporary art and design practices. Art/design vocabulary, critical thinking skills, understanding of diverse social roles of the artist and designer and relationship to visual art within contemporary culture and society.
STA112.restrictions: Open to students in the Apparel and Textile Design Major or in the Apparel and Textiles Major or in the Art Education Major or in the Graphic Design Major or in the Bachelor of Fine Arts in Studio Art or in the Studio Art Major.

STA113.name: Color and Design
STA113.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA113.description: Basic elements of two-dimensional design. Principles of organization and the theory and practice of color as a basis for creative solutions for the problems of the artist and designer.

STA114.name: Three-Dimensional Form
STA114.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA114.description: Formal elements of three-dimensional form. Application of the principles of organization as a means for producing creative solutions for the artist and designer. Related practical experience with a variety of materials and processes.

STA170.name: Digital Photography: Tools and Concepts
STA170.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
STA170.description: Digital photography controls; organization of visual elements and composition; survey of contemporary content approaches; and, introduction to image file management and adjustment.
STA170.restrictions: Not open to students in the Bachelor of Fine Arts in Studio Art or in the Studio Art Major.

STA191.name: Special Topics in Art and Design
STA191.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings proposed by faculty on a group study basis.

STA201.name: Fundamentals of Comic Art and Graphic Novels
STA201.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA201.description: Introduction to traditional and emerging visual narrative methods and comics production. Formal and conceptual strategies unique to the comics medium and critical consideration of artistic, instructional, and narrative capacities of comics. Character development, pen-and-ink, hand-illustration, and digital techniques for constructing storyboard layouts, graphic novels, and sequential art.

STA270.name: Concepts of Photography
STA270.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
STA270.description: Survey of the multifaceted role of photography in art and culture today explored through creative projects, readings, written responses and discussions.
STA270.restrictions: Not open to students in the Bachelor of Fine Arts in Studio Art or in the Studio Art Major.

STA300.name: Intermediate Drawing
STA300.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA300.description: Observational and imaginative drawing including the human figure. Non-representational drawing. Contemporary drawing systems, concepts, and processes.
STA300.prerequisite: STA 110 and STA 112 and STA 113 and STA 114

STA301.name: Advanced Comic Art and Graphic Novels
STA301.description: Advanced work in comic art and graphic novels methods and production culminating in a self-contained publication. Research and idea development. Illustration styles and narrative impact of stylistic choices in relation to personal voice. Advanced visual storytelling, writing, story boarding, narrative arcs, digital document preparation, distribution, and peer critique.

STA320.name: Painting I
STA320.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA320.description: Representational painting of landscape, figure, and still life imagery. Painting concepts, materials, and techniques.
STA320.prerequisite: STA 110 and STA 112 and STA 113 and STA 114

STA325.name: Painting II
STA325.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA325.description: Continuation of representational painting, and introduction to non-representational painting and concepts.

STA330.name: Lithography
STA330.description: Basic processes of image-making in lithography, including both traditional and contemporary methods. Fundamentals of drawing and design as applied to printmaking, as well as development of personally innovative imagery and concept. Final independent project explores both two and three dimensional applications of print techniques.
STA330.prerequisite: STA 110 and STA 112 and STA 113 and STA 114

STA335.name: Etching
STA335.description: Aesthetic principles and techniques such as soft ground, aquatint, dry point, transfer ground and crosshatching.
STA335.prerequisite: STA 110 and STA 112 and STA 113 and STA 114

STA340.name: Ceramics: Hand Building
STA340.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA340.description: Ceramic processes including handbuilding, with terra cotta clay, low-fire glaze formulation, and kiln firing as a means of cultural and artistic expression.
STA340.prerequisite: STA 110 and STA 112 and STA 113 and STA 114

STA343.name: Ceramics: Mold Making, Casting, and Serial Production
STA343.description: Design forms for serial production through hands-on experiences. Modeling techniques, plaster mold making, slip casting, glazing, and digital decal processes.
STA343.prerequisite: STA 110 and STA 112 and STA 113 and STA 114

STA345.name: Ceramics: Wheel Throwing
STA345.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA345.description: Ceramics processes including wheel throwing with stoneware clay, high-fire glaze formulation, and kiln firing as a means of cultural and artistic expression.
STA345.prerequisite: STA 110 and STA 112 and STA 113 and STA 114

STA350.name: Figure Modeling
STA350.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA350.description: Modeling human and natural forms. The figure as a means of artistic and cultural expression.
STA350.prerequisite: STA 110 and STA 112 and STA 113 and STA 114

STA351.name: Mixed Media and Installation
STA351.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA351.description: Exploration of artistic expression using mixed media and assemblage techniques. Installation techniques.
STA351.prerequisite: STA 110 and STA 112 and STA 113 and STA 114

STA354.name: Casting
STA354.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA354.description: Casting concepts and techniques as a means of artistic and cultural expression.
STA354.prerequisite: STA 110 and STA 112 and STA 113 and STA 114

STA355.name: Construction and Fabrication
STA355.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA355.description: Sculptural concepts using methods of construction and fabrication as an approach to artistic and cultural expression.
STA355.prerequisite: STA 110 and STA 112 and STA 113 and STA 114

STA370.name: Photography I
STA370.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA370.description: Introduction to photography as a fine art medium, including the functions and controls of a digital camera; photography as a means of visual art expression, in monochrome and color; the basic aspects of image adjustment software; and, historical and contemporary approaches to both technical and artistic/conceptual practice.
STA370.prerequisite: STA 110 and STA 112 and STA 113 and STA 114

STA371.name: Art, Education and Society
STA371.description: Visual theory, learning theory, and social theory in historical and cultural contexts. Fieldwork and research-based written assignments.
STA371.prerequisite: {HA 101 and HA 102} and Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

STA375.name: Photography II
STA375.description: Experimental, alternative process, photographic methods, including view camera, Polaroid, and 35mm photographic systems, film processing, digital scanning and manipulation, and production of non-traditional print formats.

STA380.name: Electronic Art
STA380.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA380.description: Using the computer as a tool for making art. Creation of innovative electronic art and new media projects that introduce students to conceptual as well as technical skill sets.
STA380.prerequisite: STA 110 and STA 112 and STA 113 and STA 114 or approval of department

STA384.name: Experiments in Digital Video
STA384.description: Introduction to core skills and concepts used in digital video production, with an emphasis on art-making, conceptual thinking, and experimentation.
STA384.prerequisite: STA 110 and STA 112 and STA 113 and STA 114 or approval of department

STA385.name: Interactive Environments and Digital Fabrication
STA385.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA385.description: Systems-based approach to design and fabrication of functional experimental art devices, combining principles of mechanical, electronic, software design, robotics, sensors, actuators, and other control devices. Exposure to new paradigms of creative practice and will develop intricate, interdisciplinary group projects.
STA385.prerequisite: STA 110 and STA 112 and STA 113 and STA 114 or approval of department

STA391.name: Special Topics in Drawing
STA391.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
STA391.description: Issues of technique, style, and content in drawing.
STA391.prerequisite: STA 110 and STA 112 and STA 113 and STA 114

STA420.name: Advanced Painting
STA420.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA420.description: Advanced applications of painting concepts, styles, and techniques. Consideration of the language of contemporary painting.

STA420S.name: Senior Project in Advanced Painting
STA420S.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA420S.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Bachelor of Fine Arts in Studio Art. Approval of department.

STA439.name: Advanced Printmaking
STA439.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA439.description: Development of aesthetic and technical skills with particular focus on contemporary issues of content and concept. Opportunity for supervised individual study.

STA439S.name: Senior Project in Advanced Printmaking
STA439S.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Bachelor of Fine Arts in Studio Art or approval of department.

STA440.name: Advanced Ceramics
STA440.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA440.description: Development of aesthetic and technical skills with particular focus on contemporary issues of content and concept. Opportunity for supervised individual study.

STA440S.name: Senior Project in Advanced Ceramics
STA440S.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA440S.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Bachelor of Fine Arts in Studio Art. Approval of department.

STA450.name: Advanced Sculpture
STA450.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA450.description: Advanced applications of sculpture concepts, styles and techniques. Consideration of the language of contemporary sculpture, with emphasis on individual direction.
STA450.prerequisite: (STA 350 and STA 351) or (STA 350 and STA 354) or (STA 350 and STA 355) or (STA 351 and STA 354) or (STA 351 and STA 355) or (STA 354 and STA 355)

STA450S.name: Senior Project in Advanced Sculpture
STA450S.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA450S.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Bachelor of Fine Arts in Studio Art. Approval of department.

STA472.name: Color Photography
STA472.description: Technical, aesthetic, and critical skills related to contemporary and historical practice in the art of color photography. Utilize digital cameras and image manipulation software to address technical and creative problems in color photography related to personal artistic goals, natural and artificial light source settings, and a range of fine art issues.

STA472S.name: Senior Project in Color Photography
STA472S.description: Intensive studio work in color photography.
STA472S.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Bachelor of Fine Arts in Studio Art. Approval of department.

STA474.name: Studio and Location Lighting
STA474.description: Technical, aesthetic and critical skills related to contemporary and historical practice in the art of artificial lighting for photography. Utilize digital and film imaging, view camera and medium format cameras. Technical and creative problems in color and black and white photography related to personal artistic goals. Control of artificial light source settings on location and in studio.

STA474S.name: Senior Project in Studio and Location Lighting
STA474S.description: Intensive studio work in studio and location lighting.
STA474S.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Bachelor of Fine Arts in Studio Art. Approval of department.

STA475.name: Photography Workshop
STA475.description: Individualized study, resulting in a portfolio expressing a cohesive, creative vision suitable for exhibition and professional presentation. Projects may address contemporary photographic issues in any creative field or format, from digital through antique processes.

STA475S.name: Senior Project in Photography
STA475S.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Bachelor of Fine Arts in Studio Art. Approval of department.

STA476.name: The Photobook
STA476.description: Digital and analog processes of making photo-driven artist books, with emphases on the development of long term photographic projects, communicating through sequence, utilizing a variety of book forms, hand binding techniques, and exploration of the contemporary photo book medium.

STA480.name: Advanced Electronic Arts and Intermedia
STA480.description: Presentation of student's ongoing research and creative projects within an interdisciplinary framework.
STA480.prerequisite: STA 384 or STA 385 or approval of department

STA481.name: Art Experiences with Children and Youth I (W)
STA481.description: Art teaching in the Saturday Art Program. Emphasis on elementary experiences. Planning and writing art curriculum.
STA481.prerequisite: (STA 371) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
STA481.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Art and Art History.

STA482.name: Art Experiences with Children and Youth II (W)
STA482.description: Art teaching in the Saturday Art Program. Emphasis on secondary experiences. Planning and writing art curriculum.
STA482.prerequisite: (STA 371) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
STA482.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Art and Art History.

STA490.name: Independent Study
STA490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA490.description: Special projects arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

STA491.name: Selected Topics in Studio Art
STA491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
STA491.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings proposed by faculty on a group study basis.

STA491A.name: Selected Topics - Painting
STA491A.description: Issues of technique, style, and content in painting.

STA491B.name: Selected Topics - Printmaking
STA491B.description: Issues of technique, style, and content in printmaking.

STA491D.name: Selected Topics - Sculpture
STA491D.description: Issues of technique, style, and content in sculpture.
STA491D.prerequisite: STA 350 or STA 351 or STA 354 or STA 355

STA491E.name: Selected Topics - Graphic Design
STA491E.description: Issues of technique, style, and content in graphic design.

STA491F.name: Selected Topics - Photography
STA491F.description: Issues of technique, style, and content in photography.

STA491G.name: Special Topics - Art Education
STA491G.description: Contemporary issues in art education. Fieldwork, studio work, and research-based written assignments.

STA491I.name: Selected Topics - Electronic Art and Intermedia
STA491I.description: Issues of technique, style, and content in electronic art and intermedia.
STA491I.prerequisite: STA 384 or STA 385 or approval of department

STA492.name: Senior Seminar and Professional Practice (W)
STA492.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA492.description: Capstone course for artists and designers. Writing as a mode of issue delineation and definition.
STA492.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I writing requirement.
STA492.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Studio Art Major.

STA492A.name: Exhibition Practicum
STA492A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA492A.description: Exhibition experience in studio art. Audience delineation. Conceptualization. Use of space. Evaluation.
STA492A.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I writing requirement.

STA493.name: Design Internship
STA493.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
STA493.description: Field experience in a working design environment under supervision of a design professional
STA493.prerequisite: STA 460 or STA 462 or STA 465 or STA 466 or STA 467 or STA 468

STA493A.name: Studio Art Internship
STA493A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA493A.description: Field Experience in a studio setting, gallery, museum, or art center that emphasizes relevant skill sets for the contemporary artist.

STA820.name: Painting
STA820.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA820.description: Advanced study in a variety of painting media to foster independent development.
STA820.restrictions: Open only to Master of Fine Arts students in Studio Art. Approval of department.

STA832.name: Lithography
STA832.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA832.description: Theory and practice of lithography as a means to create expressive imagery.
STA832.restrictions: Open only to Master of Fine Arts students in Studio Art. Approval of department.

STA833.name: Intaglio Printing
STA833.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA833.description: Theory and practice of intaglio printing as a means to create expressive imagery.
STA833.restrictions: Open only to Master of Fine Arts students in Studio Art. Approval of department.

STA840.name: Ceramics
STA840.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA840.description: Advanced study in ceramics to foster independent development.
STA840.restrictions: Open only to Master of Fine Arts students in Studio Art. Approval of department.

STA850.name: Sculpture
STA850.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA850.description: Advanced study in a variety of three-dimensional media to foster individual development.
STA850.restrictions: Open only to Master of Fine Arts students in Studio Art. Approval of department.

STA860.name: Graphic Design
STA860.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA860.description: Planning and conceptualizing ideas for visual communication problems that are to be expressed in words and/or pictures. Design of research that will expose a mastery of visual aesthetics and concepts in information design.
STA860.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in Studio Art. Approval of department.

STA880.name: Intermedia Workshop
STA880.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA880.description: Interdisciplinary research, how knowledge is acquired and produced from disciplines outside of the fine arts and applied to art production.
STA880.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Master of Fine Arts in Studio Art or approval of department.

STA890.name: Master of Fine Arts Seminar: Exploring Research, Resources, and Context
STA890.description: Exposure to diverse resources, media, techniques, and theories both, internal and external to art and design. Analysis and incorporation of varied philosophical, historical, and contemporary perspectives. Contextualization of individual artistic practice and integration of external knowledge into studio methodologies.
STA890.restrictions: Open to master of fine arts students in the Master of Fine Arts in Studio Art.

STA891.name: Master of Fine Arts Seminar: Teaching and Pedagogical Practice in Studio Art
STA891.description: Current issues and practices in Studio Art course/curriculum design. Approaches to course planning, critiques, and assessment. Development of course outcomes and expectations. Role of conceptual, formal, and technical issues. Diversity in studio art pedagogy.
STA891.restrictions: Open to master of fine arts students in the Master of Fine Arts in Studio Art.

STA892.name: Master of Fine Arts Seminar
STA892.description: Contemporary intellectual issues related to practice in the visual arts. Group critiques of individual scholarly and applied research.
STA892.restrictions: Open only to Master of Fine Arts students in Studio Art. Approval of department.

STA893.name: Master of Fine Arts Professional Seminar
STA893.description: Contemporary professional issues in the visual arts
STA893.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Department of Art, Art History, and Design or in the Master of Fine Arts in Studio Art. Approval of department.

STA895.name: Master of Fine Arts Studio: Exploration and Research in Studio Art
STA895.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA895.description: Advanced study in Studio Art focused on exploration and intersection of ideation and form and extended development in chosen media(s).
STA895.restrictions: Open to master of fine arts students in the Master of Fine Arts in Studio Art.

STA896.name: Master of Fine Arts Studio: Integration in Studio Art
STA896.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA896.description: Further study in Studio Art focused on the increased integration of form and content. Individual artistic development.
STA896.restrictions: Open to master of fine arts students in the Master of Fine Arts in Studio Art.

STA897.name: Critique
STA897.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA897.description: Presentation of artwork to faculty, peers, and community in a group setting. Communication of essential ideas and incorporation of criticism
STA897.restrictions: Open to master of fine arts students in the Master of Fine Arts in Studio Art.

STA898.name: Master of Fine Arts Final Research Project
STA898.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
STA898.description: Individual final research project in studio art directed by major professor and guidance committee.
STA898.restrictions: Open to master of fine arts students in the Master of Fine Arts in Studio Art.
